bug.author: TobyRoseman
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêûDescribe the bug</denchmark-h>
I can not import coremltools in Python 2.7. typing did not become a Python standard library until Python 3.5 <denchmark-h:h2>Trace</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>In [1]: import coremltools --------------------------------------------------------------------------- ImportError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-1-5bf9ddba4efd> in <module>() ----> 1 import coremltools
/Users/tobyroseman/anaconda3/envs/test/lib/python2.7/site-packages/coremltools/__init__.py in <module>() 52 53 # expose sub packages as directories ---> 54 from . import converters 55 from . import proto 56 from . import models
/Users/tobyroseman/anaconda3/envs/test/lib/python2.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/__init__.py in <module>() 10 from . import keras 11 from . import caffe ---> 12 from . import onnx 13 from ._converters_entry import convert 14 from .mil import (
/Users/tobyroseman/anaconda3/envs/test/lib/python2.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/onnx/__init__.py in <module>() 5 6 from coremltools._deps import _HAS_ONNX ----> 7 from ._converter import convert
/Users/tobyroseman/anaconda3/envs/test/lib/python2.7/site-packages/coremltools/converters/onnx/_converter.py in <module>() 3 from __future__ import print_function as _ 4 from __future__ import unicode_literals as _ ----> 5 from typing import Text, Union, Optional, Dict, Any, Iterable, Sequence, Callable, List 6 7 import numpy as np
ImportError: No module named typing </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>System environment (please complete the following information):</denchmark-h>
coremltools version: 4.0b3 OS: 10.15 How you install python: anaconda python version: 2.7
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
After doing a pip install typing everything seems to be working fine.
